citations.narrative:
At the time of the inspection, there were no records of dogs having complete head-to-tail physical exams by the attending
veterinarian (AV) in the past year.
Physical examinations by the AV are important to evaluate the overall health and physical body condition of dogs at the
facility. In addition, physical exams help the AV evaluate chronic medical conditions, make adjustments to treatment, and
observe changes in health status.
All dogs must have a complete physical examination from head to tail by the attending veterinarian not less than once
every 12 months.
Corrected on June 11, 2025, and forward.

Annual heartworm testing had not been documented for all dogs except for Bodie, a 2-year-old MN Border Collie mix. But
even Bodie's records showed that he was overdue for a recheck of his fecal sample to ensure that the drugs prescribed
were effective on the parasites he was diagnosed with and treated for.
Heartworm and intestinal parasite testing is important to determine if dogs have parasites that can pose a significant
health threat to their well-being, and to select what parasiticides are appropriate for their treatment and/or prevention.
Each dealer, exhibitor, and research facility must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that is
developed, documented in writing, and signed by the attending veterinarian. Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities
must keep and maintain the written program and make it available for APHIS inspection. The written program of
veterinary care must address the requirements for adequate veterinary care for every dealer and exhibitor including (in
part) vaccinations for contagious and/or deadly diseases of dogs (including rabies, parvovirus and distemper) and
sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms, coccidia, giardia, and heartworm) in
accordance with a schedule approved by the attending veterinarian.
Correct by June 30, 2025, and forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
